body.p: To the Hon B. Magoffin Governor of the Commonwealth of Kentucky

Your petitioners would respectfully state that at the March term ^1861^ of the Carroll Circuit Court William Gardner was fined $50. for selling Liquor to a minor -- That the offense was committed shortly after the law went into effect That said Gardner was not apprised at the time of the exestince of the law we further state that said Gardner is a law abiding man
We therefore believing that said Gardner is entitled to executive clemency, request your excellency to remit said fine

Petitioners
W M Fisher
M T Pryor
A, H, Lothross
A, I, Guthrie
Isaac Griffin
Jno. F. Gano
L. O"Neal
R. J. Wilson
H W Pryor
T W Minish
M. W. Dillehunt
Petitioners
A F Dunagun
Stephen Mosley
H Harris
G G Minish
F M Gert
T. C. Lawrence
David W Hogan
M T MClure

The subscribers to the foregoing petition are
citizens of Carroll County, & reliable men and their Signatures genuine
Given under my hand this 22 May 1861
John Hogan C. C. C. C

Carroll Cir. Ct
$50. } Liquor to a Minor
Wm Gardner
